settings.payment-method-description: Your payment method is used to pay for your rentals. It can be a credit card or paypal account.
settings.payout-method-description: Your payout method is where we send you your rental income. Therefore you have to add it latest when accepting a request as a lister.
settings.payment-credit-card: Your current payment method is a credit card ending with
settings.payment-paypal: Your current payment method is a paypal account with email address
settings.no-payment-method: You didn't enter any payment method so far.
settings.no-payout-method: You didn't enter any payout method so far.
settings.enter-paypal-info: Please enter the email address of your paypal account
settings.enter-bank-info: Please enter the accountholder's first and last name as well as IBAN and BIC
settings.payout-paypal: Your payout method is a paypal account with email address
settings.payout-bank: Your payout method is a bank account ending with
settings.meta-description: Change your profile - und payment settings.

1.text1: Welcome to our passionate bike sharing community, featuring lots of bikes and bike enthusiasts all over the world.
1.text-invited: As you've got invited by a friend, we've just put a voucher in your account. It gets redeemed automatically for your first rental!
1.text2: We're a sharing community, so the trust and safety of you and the other users have highest priority.
1.text3: We therefore kindly ask you to verify your profile through a few simple steps. It'll only take you a few minutes. The better the information you enter, the higher are chances that your requests will be accepted and bikes will be requested.

2.description: Upload a profile picture of yourself! Seeing the face behind a profile is what's most important for the users.

3.description: Write a couple sentences about yourself and your relation to biking. It gives your profile personality!
3.label: Description (min. 100 Characters)

4.description: Validate your email address by clicking on the link in the confirmation email that we've sent to you after signup. If you don't find it anymore, you can resend the email. If you don't receive it instantly, please wait a few minutes and look in your spam folder.

5.description: Verify your phone number, this allows SMS notifications for your requests. Simply enter your number and click 'Send Confirmation'. You'll receive a code via SMS that you can then enter below.
5.enter-valid-phone-nr: Please enter a valid phone number

ratings.description: Trust and Safety are our paramount concern. By writing a short review, you'll help the whole community.
ratings.rating_text_rider: Please summarize your rental experience in a few sentences. The lister will do the same
ratings.rating_text_lister: Please summarize your rental experience in a few sentences. The rider will do the same

requests.complete-profile-description: To book the bike, please enter your payment information. All informations are transmitted over a secure connection.
requests.no-requests-yet: As soon as you made or got requests, they'll show up here.

listChat.1: {{user.first_name}} {{user.last_name}} from {{user.city}} would like to rent your {{ride.name}} from {{timespan}}. Agree on further details using the chat.
listChat.2: You accepted the request. The rider now has the possibility to book the bike.
listChat.3:
{{user.first_name}} {{user.last_name}} confirmed the booking. You rent out your ride from {{timespan}}! Contact Details are as follows, we've also sent them to you via email.

Name: {{user.first_name}} {{user.last_name}}
Number: {{user.phone_number}}
Address: {{user.street}}, {{user.zip}} {{user.city}}, {{user.country}}
listChat.4: You've confirmed retrieval of your bike. Lastly, please rate the rider. This helps our community a lot and closes your rental.
listChat.5:
Thanks for rating. The rental was successful and the money will get transferred to the bank account you provided during the next 7 working days.

In case of any further questions or feedback, we’d love to receive them under hello@listnride.com
listChat.8: You rejected the request. Please tell the rider why you can't rent him the bike.

rideChat.1: You would like to rent the {{ride.name}} by {{lister.first_name}} {{lister.last_name}} from {{timespan}}. Agree with the lister on further details. As soon as he accepts your request, you can book the ride.
rideChat.2: {{lister.first_name}} has accepted your request. Confirm the reservation, the payment will follow as the next step.
rideChat.3:
Congratulation, You successfully booked the ride. Meet the lister as agreed and pick up the ride. Contact Details are as follows, we've also sent them to you via email.

Name: {{lister.first_name}} {{lister.last_name}},
Email address: {{lister.email}},
Address: {{ride.street}}, {{ride.zip}} {{ride.city}}, {{ride.country}}
rideChat.4: {{lister.first_name}} has confirmed the return of the ride.
rideChat.5: Finally, please rate the lister and the ride. This helps our community a lot and completes the rental.
rideChat.6: Thanks for rating, the rental was successfully completed.
rideChat.8: Unfortunately, the lister could't accept your request. Simply request some other great bikes.
rideChat.9: You cancelled the request, please tell the lister why you couldn’t confirm the booking.

calendar.select-timespan-description: Before you can request, please set the timespan of your rental. Simply click on the days and select pickup and dropoff times in the above calendar.

category.hint: First, select the category of your bike. Then select the right subcategory.
category.label: Category

details.header: What is your bike name, size & brand?
details.hint: Enter the bike brand, name and a description of your bike. The name should include the model and describe the bike to the point. e.g. Gazelle, Tour Populair, 2013. Then select a range for the appropriate riders height.
details.label: Details
details.name: Name
details.min-length-warning: Length should be at least 100 characters

accessories.header: What accessories does your bike have?
accessories.hint: Edit accessories. Select the accessories, which you can provide with your bike.
accessories.label: Accessories

pictures.header: Upload some pictures of your bike
pictures.hint: Now select some nice pictures of your bike. Here are some important photo tips for making your listing look ever better.
pictures.how-to: Photo tips for making your listing stand out
pictures.label: Pictures
pictures.upload-bike-header: Upload some pictures of your bike
pictures.under-min-size: Some of your images size is less than allowable minimum 1500x1000:

location.header: Where can the bike be picked up?
location.hint: Where is your bike located? Don’t worry, the exact location of your bike will ONLY be forwarded when you have confirmed a rental request.
location.label: Location

pricing.hint: Last, set an appropriate rental price. The price should be affordable and based on you ride and equipment. You may take similar listings as a reference. A rental period for less than 6 hours equals a half-day rental, 6 to 24 hours a day’s rental.

how-it-works.meta-description: Using listnride is as easy as meeting up for coffee. Try for yourself!
how-it-works.title: Bike sharing without the hassle
how-it-works.header: listnride helps you get into gear
how-it-works.subheader: Renting (out) a bicycle on our bike sharing platform is as easy as meeting up for coffee:

lister-section.step-2-content: For a specific time and date
lister-section.step-3-content: Or suggest a better time & date
lister-section.step-4-content: Hand-over bike, chat, give local tips
lister-section.step-5-content: Payment is credited to your account

rider-section.step-2-content: For a specific time and date
rider-section.step-3-content: Have a chat & get insider tips
rider-section.step-5-content: To owner at agreed time & place

handover-section.header: Direct or flexible bike handover: the choice is yours
handover-section.content: We’re going to go out on a limb here and say that it’s especially the nice people who ride bikes. And they even lend them to others. That’s why we believe it’s definitely worth picking up the bike directly from the owner. The added benefit: meeting great new people and getting useful tips about the local area. But if there simply isn’t enough time, listnride offers its users three ways to hand over rental bikes:
handover-section.list-1: The renter (rider) picks up the bike from the owner’s (lister’s) home.
handover-section.list-2: The lister hands over the bike to the rider at an agreed location.
handover-section.list-3: The lister locks up the bike at a public place and sends the rider the code to the combination lock.

rent-a-bike.meta-description: Fantastic selection. Great value for money. Easy online service.
rent-a-bike.title: Don’t just rent any old bike. Rent one that feels like your own.

info-section.header: Rent a bike that is perfect for you
info-section.subheader: One that complements your style and meets your needs. From people like you and me.
info-section.choice-content: The range of bikes offered on listnride is as diverse as our users. Here you will find everything from high-end road bikes and trendy urban bikes to cargo bicycles and bike trailers for kids. Rent a bike that suits your style and meets your needs.
info-section.price-content: The bikes listed on our platform are rented out by private owners as well as specialist dealers and rental services. What’s in it for you: the perfect bike at good value for money.
info-section.easy-content: Find and book your rental bike before going on a trip or simply on the go – online or using our

search-section.header: Where would you like to go?
search-section.subheader: listnride’s bike sharing service is becoming available in more and more locations.

testmonials-section.header: What do our riders say about us?
testmonials-section.subheader: More and more people are discovering the benefits of bike sharing via listnride. Check out some of their testimonials:

list-a-bike.meta-description: Meet fun new people and make some extra pocket money.
list-a-bike.title: Rent out a bike, earn some extra cash
list-a-bike.subtitle: Meet great new people and earn some money on the side, for example for the next bike of your dreams.

calculator-section.header: Let your bike work for you
calculator-section.subheader: Just a few clicks and our slide rule will show you how much you can earn by renting out a bike via listnride
calculator-section.days-per-month: Days per month your bike is rented

info-section.precautions-content: You want to rent out your bike – but not to just anybody. That’s why we verify the identity of all our users for you. And our user ratings help you find out whether they play fair in the bike sharing scene.
info-section.control-content: You decide the daily or weekly rate for your bike(s). It’s completely up to you whether you want to accept a rental request or simply reject it because you can’t or don’t want to lend someone your bike at the moment.
info-section.covered-content: In case of damage or theft, we’re right there by your side. And, if necessary, the listnride lister guarantee worth EUR 5,000 has got you covered.
info-section.help-content: If you and a renter (rider) encounter a problem and can’t find a solution, we’re there for you – to support you or even resolve the entire issue.

list-section.subheader: Meet great new people and earn some money on the side.
list-section.sign-up: Sign up to list your bike!

testmonials-section.header: Renting out bikes: What do our listers say about us?
testmonials-section.subheader: Many people have already become a sharing part of our listnride community. Read about their personal experiences:

trust-and-safety.meta-title: Bike hire made safe – listnride has your back
trust-and-safety.meta-description: Trust is the be-all and end-all in a sharing community. We promote fairness and safety by verifying our users’ identities and offering a lister guarantee.
trust-and-safety.title: Trust & Safety
trust-and-safety.subheader: Thanks to listnride, renting a bike is as safe as it is easy.

guarantee.title: listnride’s lister guarantee
guarantee.content: Listnride is a community of bike enthusiasts. But hey, sometimes things go wrong no matter how careful you are. That’s why we have our lister guarantee at the ready: If your bike gets damaged or stolen during the bike hire and the rider cannot pay compensation, the guarantee ensures coverage of up to EUR 5,000. The payments are subject to certain conditions, limitations and exceptions. For more information, please refer to our Rental Terms and Conditions.

responsibility.title: We treat your data responsibly
responsibility.content: The exact address or location of your bike does not appear on your public profile. This data is only passed on to the sharing partner once a booking is confirmed.

verification.title: Verification creates trust
verification.content: Theoretically, everyone knows everyone else by 3.5 to 6.6 degrees of separation. But would you really want to rely on that when renting out your bike to someone? Provide personal details in your profile to increase your trustworthiness when communicating with a lister or rider regarding the bike hire. There are several ways you can verify a person’s identity on listnride:
verification.list-1: ID Verification: Connect your listnride profile with your facebook page and store your credit card details. Make sure you can receive e-mails.
verification.list-2: Phone number: We pass on your verified phone number to your lister/rider as soon as a booking request is accepted.
verification.list-3: Ratings: Your profile features the ratings submitted by your riders and listers after the bike hire. This allows you to build up a good reputation.

about-us.title: About us
about-us.subheader: How conventional bike rental services inspired us to create a diverse bike sharing community.

community.title: listnride: the idea that sparked a community
community.content: Here at listnride, we all love bikes. Each of us has their personal favorite that they cherish, and we enjoy the wonderful diversity of two-wheelers: from urban bikes to mountain bikes, from speedy road bikes to super-fast S-pedelecs, from eccentric ponies to reliable pack mules. That’s why we began asking ourselves: Why isn’t it possible to choose and have a specific bike that you need for a particular purpose at any time, regardless of whether you’re traveling or in your home town? Will we always be stuck with the low-entry bikes from the local rental shop? And thus the idea of setting up the listnride bike sharing community was born.

future.title: listnride: full speed ahead
future.content: Today, listnride is available in big cities like Amsterdam, Berlin, Munich and Vienna. And that number keeps growing. Private owners as well as specialized dealers offer their bikes for rent on our platform. This enables tourists and locals, families and businesspeople to find the ideal bike that complements their personal style and meets their needs – and perhaps even get one or two useful tips about the local area from the lister. Our idea has become a reality. Be a part of it and share your bike – or simply ride any bike you want! We look forward to welcoming you to our community.

about-us.meta-description: Founded by bike enthusiasts for their brothers and sisters in spirit.

press.title: Press
press.subheader: Information is ready to be downloaded. listnride is ready to talk.

kit.title: Press kit
kit.content: Others call themselves bike rental systems. We are a bike sharing community. Find out more in our press kit, which can be

contact.title: Press contact
contact.content: Do you have further questions about listnride or need more information about bike sharing systems, rental bikes and mobility concepts? Then you can contact us directly:

press.meta-description: We love bike sharing. And we’ll gladly answer all your questions.

jobs.title: Jobs
jobs.subheader: help our bike sharing community grow.

contact.title: Join our team
contact.content: Do you always know more about bikes than others? Do you love jumping on the saddle and going for a ride, come rain or shine? Then you are in all likelihood a true bike aficionado – and would make a great addition to our team. Have a look to see if we currently have a vacancy that is right for you, and feel free to send us your application.

jobs.meta-description: Join the listnride bike sharing team in Berlin or Munich to build the global biking community

contact-and-help.title: Contact & Support
contact-and-help.meta-description: Contact us if you have special questions or need help solving a problem

faq-section.subheader: The most frequently questions of our Lister and Rider.

lister-faq.title: FAQ Lister
lister-faq.question-1: What do I need to do to rent out my bike with peace of mind?
lister-faq.answer-1: Once you receive a rental request, you can communicate with the requester via the convenient chat feature. You’ll already have a good idea of who the person is and why they wish to rent your bike. The listnride platform provides user verification to minimize the risk of fraud. If you would like even more peace of mind, you could ask the renter to bring an ID for further verification and/or give you a safety deposit when picking up the bike. Keep in mind that everybody wants to have a great time and enjoy the ride, and will therefore be careful with the bike you rented out to them.
lister-faq.question-2: How can I be sure that the rider will return my bike?
lister-faq.answer-2: We do our best to create a marketplace based on trust and respect. This is why we require our users to verify their identity before they rent someone’s bike or offer their own bike for rent. Verification is done via mobile phone number, facebook or e-mail and payment details. If you still feel unsure, you can ask the rider to give you a copy of their ID card and/or leave a certain safety deposit. In that case, please make sure to let the rider know in advance before he/she confirms and pays for the rental. Nevertheless, the rider might be running late, as they aren’t familiar with the area and might therefore not be able to find the way back that easily. Try contacting the rider by phone, text message or the in-app chat to find out the reason for the delay. If this doesn’t work out, please report the situation via our website by clicking on “Contact & Support.” We will contact the rider and resolve the issue to make sure your bike is returned to you.
lister-faq.question-3: What happens if my bike gets stolen or damaged?
lister-faq.answer-3: Bike theft does happen. However, the bike is less likely to get stolen if it is properly locked and/or stored indoors. Help prevent theft by providing a secure lock with your bike. In case something does go wrong, the rider will be held responsible for all costs arising from any damage and/or theft. If your bike was stolen and/or damaged during the rental period, you and the rider need to contact us through our website by clicking on “Contact us.” Once we’ve clarified the situation, we will contact you to resolve the issue. If it was stolen and the rider can’t pay the damages, the listnride guarantee will make sure everything is covered! If the bike was stolen while it wasn’t rented out through listnride, however, we cannot help solve the problem. In this case you need to resolve the issue directly with the rider.
lister-faq.question-4: What happens if the rider or someone else gets injured and/or property gets damaged during the rental period?
lister-faq.answer-4: Make sure that your bike is in good condition when you hand it over. This is beneficial to both parties: The rider will have a great time, and you’ll receive a positive rating after the bike has been returned. When booking a bike through listnride, the renter agrees to the applicable terms and conditions. These terms and conditions offer you protection against liability for any injury to the renter and/or damage to their or someone else’s property. As the lister, you are never responsible if the renter gets injured during a ride.
lister-faq.question-5: What happens if the rider doesn’t show up as agreed to pick up my bike?
lister-faq.answer-5: Sometimes the rider might have difficulty getting to the agreed location. A bit of flexibility on your part is essential. However, if things are taking too long and you’ve tried contacting the rider – either through the listnride in-app chat or directly by telephone – but he/she is not responding, please cancel the rental by sending the rider a message in the chat thread and describing the reason for the cancellation.
lister-faq.question-6: How do I offer my bike for rent?
lister-faq.answer-6: You need to sign up first before you can offer your bike for rent. Simply click on “Sign up” and fill in the required details. Once you’ve signed up, simply log in using your e-mail address and password. Click on your account in the top right corner and select “List a ride.” Provide all the necessary details, including some nice clear pictures of your bike, and after setting the rental price, click on “List my ride.” It’ll take a few seconds for the information to be uploaded. Afterwards, you can find, edit and delete your bike in the account menu under “Listed rides.”
lister-faq.question-7: How do I set the rental price for my bike?
lister-faq.answer-7: You are free to decide any price for half-day/full-day/weekly rental. The minimum is €1. An attractive price will result in more rentals, as people are looking for good value for money. To determine the right price, look at similar bikes on listnride and/or compare the price with local bike shops in your area.
lister-faq.question-8: What do I pay for offering my bike to rent?
lister-faq.answer-8: Offering your bike for rent on listnride is free. Only when a booking takes place do we deduct a commission from the total rental price. We charge 7.5% of the total rental price. Example: If you rent out your bike for 5 days at €20 per day, the total rental price will be €100 euros, of which we will pay you €92.50. This includes all costs incurred for credit card fees.
lister-faq.question-9: How do I receive the money for renting out my bike?
lister-faq.answer-9: The total rental price minus the 7.5% listnride commission will be paid into your bank account within 5 business days after the rental period is over. The money will be transferred via PayPal or bank wire. You can enter and/or alter your payment details in your listnride account by clicking on “Edit profile.”
lister-faq.question-10: Can I also offer my bike for rent in other locations than currently listed on the website?
lister-faq.answer-10: Yes. listnride is a global platform and therefore open to any bike anywhere.
lister-faq.question-11: How do I temporarily suspend my listing or deactivate my bike?
lister-faq.answer-11: If you aren’t able to offer your bike for a certain period of time, you don’t need to delete your listing. Instead, you can deactivate the bike by selecting “Listed rides” in the account menu, where you can see your bike(s). Now simply click on “Deactivate bike” for the bike you would like to deactivate.
lister-faq.question-12: How do I change the pictures or details of my bike?
lister-faq.answer-12: You can alter the pictures and/or details of your bike by clicking on “Listed rides” in the account menu. Then select “Edit ride” and make the desired changes. Confirm the changes by clicking on “Update ride.”
lister-faq.question-13: How do I delete my bike listing?
lister-faq.answer-13: In case you no longer can or want to offer a certain bike for rent, you can delete it by going to “Listed rides” in the account menu. If you’re using our iPhone app, swipe the bike you would like to delete to the left and click “delete”. If you’re using our website, select “Delete ride.” After a few seconds, you’ll see a confirmation message that says “Bike successfully deleted.”
lister-faq.question-14: How do I rent out my bike through listnride?
lister-faq.answer-14: Once you receive a request for your bike, open the app or go to our website and log into your account. Click on your account page in the top right corner and click on “Request to me” in the account menu. Here you will see the request that has been sent to you. Click on the request and reply to the requester by either accepting or rejecting the request. You can also chat with the requester at the same time to clarify any details. Once you accept the request, the other person needs to confirm his/her request and pay in advance. As soon as the confirmation and payment are complete, you will receive a notification via e-mail as well as a status update in your account.
lister-faq.question-15: What do I do if the rental period initially requested is not the same as the actual period?
lister-faq.answer-15: If the final rental period has changed while you are communicating with the requester, it’s wise to ask them for a new request with the correct date and time, so that the rental is covered by the listnride guarantee.
lister-faq.question-16: What do I do if the requested rental period is inconvenient?
lister-faq.answer-16: If the requested rental period doesn’t fit into your schedule, you could check if someone else can hand over the bike and keys on your behalf. If that’s not possible, simply reject the request. Adding a short message stating why you rejected the request would be appreciated.
lister-faq.question-17: How do I contact the rider once the bike rental is confirmed?
lister-faq.answer-17: You can contact the renter via the same in-app chat that you were using for the rental request. Simply go to the “Requests to me” tab in your account menu and click on the bike you rented out. You’ll also find all of the renter’s details, including their mobile phone number, in the rental confirmation e-mail.
lister-faq.question-18: How do I get ratings for my listing?
lister-faq.answer-18: After the rental is over, the rider will be asked to rate you as a lister as well as your bike. Once the rating is submitted, your bike will show a rating value. To get good ratings, we recommend describing your bike and its condition truthfully.

rider-faq.title: FAQ Rider
rider-faq.question-1: How do I rent a bike?
rider-faq.answer-1: You need to sign up first before you can rent a bike. Simply click on “Sign up” and fill in the required details. Once you’ve signed up, simply log in using your e-mail address and password. After selecting the bike that suits your needs, select your desired start date, pick-up time, end date and drop-off time and then click on “Request ride.” Once your request is accepted by the lister, you need to confirm your rental request by clicking on “Confirm request” and completing the payment process. As soon as the payment is successfully complete, you’ll receive a booking confirmation message as well as an e-mail with the all relevant rental details.
rider-faq.question-2: How do I cancel a request?
rider-faq.answer-2: In the request status, you can cancel the request at any time before the payment process is completed by clicking on “Cancel request” in the request window.
rider-faq.question-3: Can I send more than one request at the same time?
rider-faq.answer-3: Yes, you can request multiple bikes at the same time. This makes sense in order to get a faster response from one of the bike owners. Once one of the bike owners has accepted your request, you can confirm your request. As long as you don’t confirm, there will be no booking and therefore no payment transaction. When you do book a ride, please remember to cancel all other requests for the same rental period so the other owners are duly informed.
rider-faq.question-4: What do I do if the lister doesn't respond?
rider-faq.answer-4: Unfortunately, not every lister is able to reply right away, for example if they don’t have Internet access at the moment. We do everything we can to improve response times. If you are requesting a rental on short notice, we recommend requesting multiple rides at the same time to increase the chances of you finding a ride that suits your style and needs.
rider-faq.question-5: How do I pay for the bike rental?
rider-faq.answer-5: You can confirm and pay for the request in the app or on our website. Payment is possible by credit card or PayPal. We are working on making new payment methods available– stay tuned.
rider-faq.question-6: What do I do in case of a flat tire?
rider-faq.answer-6: A flat tire can happen while riding the bike. It’s your responsibility to return the bicycle in the condition in which it was handed over to you. Either find a bike shop and have the tire repaired, or contact the lister and agree on a fair compensation. We believe a fair compensation should be around €15.
rider-faq.question-7: How should I lock my bike safely to prevent theft?
rider-faq.answer-7: To prevent the bike from getting stolen, we recommend checking with the lister with regard to local customs. In general, we would advise pulling the lock through the front tire as well as the frame, and attaching the bike to a fixed object (lamp post, tree, etc.) so it can’t be moved easily. If you’re keeping the bike overnight, we recommend storing the bike in a closed area or indoors.
rider-faq.question-8: What if the bike gets stolen during the rental period?
rider-faq.answer-8: It’s very unfortunate if the bike gets stolen. Please notify our helpdesk right away if this happens. We’ll let you know what needs to be done. Remember: The bike is your full responsibility for the duration of the rental period, and you might have to replace the bike.
rider-faq.question-9: Do I have insurance coverage when I rent with listnride?
rider-faq.answer-9: Listnride doesn’t provide any insurance; we only facilitate the rental transaction. All bike rentals are at the renter’s risk, meaning you will be held responsible for any theft or damage to the ride during the rental period. We recommend that renters check their traveinsurance and/or liability insurance for possible coverage.
rider-faq.question-10: What if the bike doesn’t resemble the one I thought I booked?
rider-faq.answer-10: Please send us some pictures of the bike and explain how it is different from the one you originally booked, so that we can cancel the rental if your claim appears justified. Alternatively, you can rate the bike accordingly when asked to submit a rating after the rental period is over.
rider-faq.question-11: Do I need to bring my own lock and helmet, and can I bring my own pedals/saddle?
rider-faq.answer-11: If the lister doesn’t provide a bicycle lock, we recommend bringing your own. Remember: You are responsible for bringing the bike back and making sure it doesn’t get stolen. Listers can provide helmets if they wish, but if you prefer wearing your own or none is provided, you should bring your own helmet. In case you would like to change the pedals or saddle, please get prior approval from the lister. Remember: This is someone else’s bike, not yours.

contact-section.subheader: Contact us if you have any special questions or if any issues arise during the bike sharing process on listnride.
contact-section.title: Can’t find the answer you need in our FAQ section? Then choose one of the following:
contact-section.list-1: I would like to report a suspicious request
contact-section.list-2: I would like to report a suspicious listing
contact-section.list-3: I would like to report a problem about my rider/lister
contact-section.list-4: I have a question regarding payments

terms-and-conditions.meta-description: The Terms and Conditions of the Bike-Sharing-Community listnride apply to the use of the online platform.
terms-and-conditions.title: Terms and conditions
terms-and-conditions.header: General Terms and Conditions of Business for the listnride Online Platform
terms-and-conditions.description: <a href="http://cdn.listnride.com/en/tacs.pdf" target="_blank">You can view and download the TaCs here.
terms-and-conditions.subtitle: List and Ride GmbH (hereinafter “listnride”) arranges rental agreements for bicycles and other sport and leisure equipment via the website www.listnride.com (hereinafter “Website”). The following General Terms and Conditions of Use (hereinafter “Terms of Use”) in Section I shall form part of the agreement concluded between the user and listnride in respect of the arrangement service. Any agreement for rental of the used item (hereinafter “Rental Agreement”) concluded via the Website shall comply with the General Terms and Conditions of Rental (hereinafter “Rental Terms”) specified in Section II.

privacy.title: Privacy
privacy.subtitle: Data Protection Regulations
privacy.description:
List and Ride GmbH (hereinafter “listnride”) informs you in the Data Protection Regulations about how your personal data are handled.

You can view and download the data protection regulations here.
privacy.meta-description: The Privacy Policy of the Bike-Sharing-Community listnride apply to the use of the online platform.

imprint.title: Imprint
imprint.meta-description: Rent your perfect bike from the listnride community. Find one that suits your style and needs.

rapha-super-cross.text: Rapha Super Cross returns to Munich’s Olympic Park on 29-30 October, for the third edition of what has quickly become a legendary cyclocross festival. If you would like to participate but are not having the right bicycle, you can rent one through listnride. Bike enthusiasts like you are offering the different bikes below. You can request and book the rides prior to the event and pick-up your bike as agreed with the owner. Bike owners can also offer their idle bike for rent and so make some money while meeting interesting people participating in the event. Become a part of our growing community!

in-velo-veritas.meta-title: In Velo Veritas - Rent a bike with listnride
in-velo-veritas.meta-description: Rent the perfect steel vintage bike for In Velo Veritas. listnride has a selection of classic bikes for rent for this beautiful tour of the Austrian wine country.
in-velo-veritas.title: In Velo Veritas - The vintage bicycle tour that's timeless
in-velo-veritas.text: The legendary “In Velo Veritas” happens this year the 5th time at the 10th/11th June 2017 in Stockerau. For those, who want to participate but need a guideline-matching bicycle, we collected some suiting bikes of our community-members to save your day. Just rent it! Bike enthusiasts like you are offering the different bikes below. If you can’t participate, have more vintage bicycles, or just want want to meet like-minded people, you can share your bike on our platform with others! Become a part of our growing community and make some extra money with your passion!

velothon-bikerental.meta-title: Simply rent the perfect road bike for the Velothon Berlin
velothon-bikerental.meta-description: Take part in the Velothon Berlin 2017! Rent a road bike from the listnride bike sharing community and join in on the fun!
velothon-bikerental.title: Simply rent the perfect road bike for the Velothon Berlin
velothon-bikerental.text:
We can hook you up! Together with the listnride community, we provide suitable road bikes which you can easily rent for as long as you like. Just choose one of the bikes below, request it for your required period, and pick it up when the time comes. Simple as that.

You can’t participate? Help out someone in need. List your bike and make some extra pocket money!

Next to the bikes you can rent below, we are inviting you to our social warm-up ride the day before! Join us for an easy pace spin and have lunch with and on us, afterwards. More info and registration.

coffeespin.title: Get ready for the Velothon!
coffeespin.text-1:
For all those participating in the Velothon Berlin, there’s now a perfect opportunity to ride and socialize with like-minded cyclists a day prior to the race.
listnride & Radsport.land present this event in cooperation with our partners Wahoo & Katusha, and we invite you to participate for free! The event is limited to 75 participants, so please RSVP soon!


Still need a road bike for the big weekend? We’ve got a wide selection of race-worthy bikes available during the Velothon. They’re going fast, so book yours here today!
coffeespin.text-2:
Where Saturday, June 17th, 2017

When Coffee at 09:30 am at the S-Bahn Grunewald - Schmetterlingsplatz Berlin

Departure 10:00 am

Distance up to 70 km

Speed 24-27 kmh, nice and easy, conversational pace

After the trip Tasty lunch & refreshing drinks @factoryberlin - Rheinsberger Str. 76/77, Berlin

Requirements road bike, helmet and click pedals

depart.meta-title: Rent a road bike for the Grand Départ on listnride
depart.meta-description: Join listnride and Schicke Mütze for a social road ride in celebration of the Grand Départ. Rent a high-end road bike from the listnride bike-sharing community.
depart.text-1:
Calling all cyclists in town for the start of the Tour de France in Düsseldorf - Let’s ride!

Together with our friends at Schicke Mütze, we invite you to an easy paced social ride. We will ride a nice tour through the hilly surroundings of Düsseldorf, starting and finishing at the Schicke Mütze shop.

If you still need a road bike for the ride, you’re welcome to rent a high-end bike from the listnride bike-sharing community. See you out there :)
depart.title: Join us for a social ride and discover Düsseldorf's beautiful surroundings!
depart.text-2:
Start with coffee at the Schickemutze - Untere Talstraße 22-24, Dusseldorf

Departure at 10:00 hours

Distance up to 60 km

Tempo 24-27 kmh, easy going

After the ride from 18:00 - BBQ & Drinks @ Schickemutze - Untere Talstraße 22-24, Dusseldorf

Requirements Road bike, helmet and click pedal

crossride.title: listnride Crossride
crossride.text:
During the Berliner Fahrradschau we want to explore with you our local cross playground, the forest with uncountable awesome trails, the Grunewald.

On the 5th of March 10am sharp we start rolling from the front gate BFS venue STATION Berlin. The social paced ride lasts for ~3 hours / 50km in the nature and bring you back well charged. We highly recommend a CX/Gravel bike, warm clothes, and a fit body. Helmets are required!

In case you need a suitable bike or would like to test a new cross bike, check out the great Bikes offered by Votec and our community below. If you like to join, you need to register. As part of the BFS program we offer you a discounted ticket for the show. After registration for the listnride CX ride, you get a coupon-code for your ticket purchase.

mcbw.description: Explore Munich by bike, go cycling with listnride!
mcbw.subdescription: Together with Brompton and Ampler we rent out fantastic bikes for free
mcbw.text-1: Conceived as the Airbnb for bicycles, listnride offers an alternative to the classic bike rental: private owners, dealers or manufacturers offer their bicycles for rent on listnride. Tourists, citizens, families, sportsmen and business travelers rent the right bike for their style and needs.
mcbw.text-2: Especially for the MCBW, visitors can rent a bike of the brands Brompton Folding Bike and Ampler E-Bike for free (Voucher Code: LNR2017) for half a day. listnride pursues the vision of offering as many people anywhere in the world uncomplicated access to high-quality, stylish bicycles. If you want to explore Munich, go cycling with listnride!
mcbw.location-description: Choose one of the four locations
mcbw.location-text:
The four locations are ① Munix Finest Bicycles in Wörthstraße 11, ② Velofactum in Schopenhauerstraße 69,
③ Velocompany in Schleißheimerstraße 106 and ④ listnride at Pündterplatz 1

home.title: listnride at the Cycling World Düsseldorf
home.description: Düsseldorf will host a new lifestyle trade fair around cycling: the Cycling World. We, listnride will be at the main entrance with selected brands and manufacturers such as Ampler and Cervélo, to present our bike sharing platform with exclusive of test-rides. In addition, we invite you to explore the surrounding countryside on two guided roadbike tours to bring the motivation gained at the fair straight to the road!
home.pp-description: Whether you’re a seasoned racer or a brand new roadie, the Push'n'Post Ride provides the perfect opportunity to join for a social ride in the beautiful surroundings of Düsseldorf during CWD. The ride is powered by Cervelo and Cycle Cafe.
home.kr-description: Together with the Schickemütze we host a group ride which will take you out the city to the beautiful country-side where an abounded rocket station will be one of the highlights. Rental bikes are available by Cervélo and Ridley.
home.title2: We've got perfect bikes to try, by Ampler und Cervélo
home.subtitle2: Whether you want to try the bike a minute or an hour - simply book it for free
home.ampler: The Estonian start-up will provide innovative and urban E-Bikes to test ride. Choose between Hawk, the dynamic single-speed or Bilberry, the comfortable city-bike and get to know e-bikes on a whole new level.
home.cervelo: The Canadian roadbike manufacturer Cervélo will bring the latest models to the Cycling World, which you can test out during one of the social rides over the weekend.

pp.title: Push'n'Post
pp.text-1:
This event provides the perfect occasion for you to join a social ride during Cycling World Düsseldorf. Cervélo offers some of their latest models to test for free. Whether you’re a seasoned racer or a brand-new roadie, the Push'n'Post ride invites you to join for this social ride in the beautiful surroundings of Düsseldorf. Sign-up and book one of the outstanding Cervélo Bikes for the ride, first come first served. Find the overview of all bikes available just below.

Further, we raffle two races for the 24h race at RadamRing 2017 with Cycle-Cafe 8 team. With an exclusive Cervélo racer during the event, the question of the perfect material for the race is also clarified.

The price includes:
- Participation in the 24h Race at the Cycle Cafe on 29. & 30.07.
- Cervélo road bike incl. Bikefitting for the entire duration of the event
- Cervélo / Cycle Cafe VIP package
pp.text-2:
Start: 25.03, 11:00AM Cervelo / Cycle Cafe booth D1/2

Roll out: at 11:30AM from the listnride booth O1

Distance: This ride will be 60 to 70 km

Pace: 24-27 kph avg, moderat

After Ride: Fuel up with a coffee and a snack

Requirements: Road bike, helmets and clipless shoes

kr.title: Kuchen und Raketen
kr.text-1:
If you do not own a roadbike, or just do not want to bring your own bike, we have roadbikes available which you can easily rent for free for the ride. During the Cycling World, we are hosting a group ride which will take you out of the city into the countryside. Leaving from our booth (# O-1) on the fair ground, we’ll head towards the former rocket station Hombroich, where we will have a quick stop with snacks and drinks. Refuelled from the break the ride will continue through the relatively unknown but beautiful scenery until we’re back at the fairground. Arrived back at the fairground, you are invited to have a refreshment at the booth of Schickemütze (# xx)

Test bikes are available from Cervélo and Ridley. Sign-up and book one of the outstanding bikes for the ride for free, first come first served. The overview of all bikes available you can find here (deeplink to bike page)
kr.text-2:
Meet: 26.03, 10:00AM, Start 10:30 at the listnride booth (O-1)

Distance: ca. 75km

Speed: 25-28 kmh, moderate

Pit-Stop: A Café at the Rocketstation Hombroich provides snacks and drinks

Requirement: Roadbike, Helmet, Clipless shoes

error-404.title: 404 Page not found
error-404.details: The page you are looking for does not exist!

berlin.meta-title: Explore Berlin by bike with listnride
berlin.meta-description: Discover Berlin by bike. With listnride, you can find a bike for rent in Berlin that matches your needs and your style.
berlin.title: Berlin
berlin.subtitle: Explore Berlin by bike
berlin.description: Find interesting places off the beaten track
berlin.search-title: Have a look at the selection of rental bikes in Berlin
berlin.search-subtitle: Rent a bike fitting your style and need
berlin.about-content: In the last decade, Berlin has seen a massive increase in cycling, bringing a new dimension to Berlin’s vivid bike culture. The fact that the city and the country side surrounding Berlin have so much to offer as well as the bike-friendly geography (winters are warmer) could be a reason why this is happening.
berlin.bike-routes-content: The Tempelhofer Feld offers the perfect playground for outdoor activities. The former airport runways are great for biking some laps and enjoying the scenery of urban sports and games taking place around you. At Treptower Park you’ll find an interesting potpourri of experiences. There is the Soviet monument which reminds you of the times when Germany was split into two nations. For those who prefer to have their fingers on the pulse of the time, a little trip along the Landwehrkanal can be a great way of discovering Berlin, starting in the green scenery of Treptow and going all the way into urban Kreuzberg and Neukölln. If you like longer rides check the Panke Radweg (~30km) which takes you through the rural areas of Berlin Wedding. More nature? Try a part of the Berlin to Usedom route, taking you through almost untouched nature and serene settings.
berlin.bike-shops-content: Berlin has many local brands that were recently founded. The urban brand Schindelhauer makes very stylish bikes for the sporty city biker. If you prefer a single-speed or fixed gear then you can eat your heart out at 8bar and Bike Punk. If you prefer a road bike then Standert can definitely offer you something special. There are also many interesting concept stores. Prèt-á-vélo offer a broad selection of classic bicycles and accessories, Wingwheels for the broadest selection of e-bikes. If you have a passion for folding bikes and everything around it, boxbike offers a great shop experience.
berlin.cafes-bars-content: After a day out we recommend to you to visit five elephant in Neukölln or Mitte to grab a coffee or two and try their selection of north American style pastry. For lunch or dinner head for Kimchi Princess in Kreuzberg, a buzzing Korean restaurant with sizzling BBQ grills. Visit Kaschk in Mitte serving a great selection of Scandinavian and local craft beer as well as freshly roasted coffee.

munich.meta-title: Explore Munich by bike with listnride
munich.meta-description: Discover Munich by bike. With listnride, you can find a bike for rent in Munich that matches your needs and your style.
munich.title: Munich
munich.subtitle: Explore Munich by bike
munich.description: Find interesting places off the beaten track
munich.search-title: Have a look at selection of rental bikes in Munich
munich.search-subtitle: Rent a bike fitting your style and need
munich.about-content: Cycling in Munich is a unique experience. The city offers a bike-friendly infrastructure and a variety of beautiful outskirts close by. A look at Munich’s cityscape reveals the enormous popularity of cycling among all styles. You can hang out in the innercity and only a couple of pedal strokes later, the countryside begins to unfold itself. With hundreds of miles of marked bike routes and dedicated cycling lanes in town and its surrounding are perfect cycling terrain.
munich.bike-routes-content: It was 1972 when the Summer Olympic Games took place at the Olympiapark in Munich. Nowadays the Olympia park has developed into a popular place for a spin around the grounds. Close to the city center, you'll find "the central park" of Munich, the Englischer Garten. It has a tranquil and nobel ambiance, inviting you and your bike to explore further. Go up to Aumeister Beergarten on the north end of the park and treat yourself with a typical Bavarian mass. If you're looking for trails: Keep an eye on the east side of the Isar River. It provides miles of trails for all abilities.
munich.bike-shops-content: If you want to get to know Munich's cycling scene, we recommend you to visit some of the following shops. At Bikedress you'll find an assortment of the finest cycling apparel and accessories, featuring brands like ASSOS and PEDAL ED. Getting hungry/thirsty? No worries, next door to Bikedress you'll find the "Monaco velo club Café" which provides you with authentic Italian specialties in a classic cycling atmosphere. Guten Bike is a specialized bike shop focused on high-quality repairs, restorations, and custom builds. If you are more interested in well-designed urban bicycles you should definitely have a look at MunixFinest.
munich.cafes-bars-content: Necado in Schwabing takes care of your daily coffee supply. Looking for food? Go to Charlie, the Vietnamese restaurant, which offers excellent traditional vietnamese dishes in a relaxed loungy setting. The typical Bavarian ambiance, you'll find at Fraunhofer. Nice located in the Glockenbackviertel, Frauenhofer offers exactly what Bavaria is known for: good beer, and traditional heavy food.

amsterdam.meta-title: Explore Amsterdam by bike with listnride
amsterdam.meta-description: Discover Amsterdam by bike. With listnride, you can find a bike for rent in Amsterdam that matches your needs and your style.
amsterdam.title: Amsterdam
amsterdam.subtitle: Explore Amsterdam by bike
amsterdam.description: Find interesting places off the beaten track
amsterdam.search-title: Have a look at the selection of rental bikes in Amsterdam
amsterdam.search-subtitle: Rent a bike fitting your style and need
amsterdam.about-content: The bike capital of Europe has a lot to offer for bike lovers. With a very bicycle centric infrastructure, it is a true pleasure to get around town. As you will notice the locals will do almost anything on their bikes, incidentally creating bike traffic jams.  Locals do bike all year around in any weather condition. The Amsterdam bike culture is a vibrant mix of classic “Dutch” bicycles, cargo bikes so called “Bakfiets” and sporty road bikes.
amsterdam.bike-routes-content: Biking around town is really a pleasure. You can start with the canals, check the "9 straatjes" and continue riding towards the museum square followed by a visit to the lively daily market de Albert Cuyp. Will take you only 30-45 mins. If you would like to ride a bit further there are a few nice routes we recommend. Discovering the water ways and some historic sea defenses towards the former "Zuider Zee", nowadays “het IJsselmeer” ride towards Durgerdam and end up in Marken. This route is around 50km. A bit shorter is to go south to the Amsterdam forest and enjoy the peaceful surroundings.
amsterdam.bike-shops-content: A new generation of bike brands have emerged, using the knowledge and quality standards of Dutch bike making adding a modern twist. For a look at the latest designs, we recommend you to pay a visit to the showroom of VanMoof, well known for their extraordinary and award winning design. Located in the city center. After a little ride to the North side of town you’ll find Mees, producing high-end custom made road bicycles from carbon or Titanium. Real fancy stuff!
amsterdam.cafes-bars-content: After a long day biking around you’ll enjoy a refreshment. A must visit is the Rapha boutique, home of the Rapha Cycling Club. It combines a nice selection of bike apparel with freshly roasted coffee. Having had enough of the biking topic and just want some nice food or some drinks, visit the historic side "The Hallen". It recently opened its doors accommodating art style cinema’s, restaurants and bars a TV studio and a hall for craftsmanship. Another top location, where you can go and relax with a view, is the Adamtoren. Opposite of central station you'll have the best views over the old town!

vienna.meta-title: Explore Vienna by bike with listnride
vienna.meta-description: Discover Vienna by bike. With listnride, you can find a bike for rent in Vienna that matches your needs and your style.
vienna.title: Vienna
vienna.subtitle: Explore Vienna by bike
vienna.description: Find interesting places off the beaten track
vienna.search-title: Have a look at the selection of rental bikes in Vienna
vienna.search-subtitle: Rent a bike fitting your style and need
vienna.about-content: Vienna. The imperial city on the Danube, slowly transforming into a bike minded metropolis. Especially on its own festivals such as Argus Bike, Radkult, and in 2016, the Wiener Fahrradschau, a spin-off of the Berlin Fahrradschau took place for the first time. Next to these events, there is no way to miss the local cycling scene, as it has grown as fast as the city itself and reclaims the streets.
vienna.bike-routes-content: The modern urban development of Vienna, with its strong focus on bicycle culture, is predestinated for a two-wheeled exploring. The Danube, which runs through Vienna, offers a wide range of activities. Following the bike paths along the river, countless beautiful meadows and parks invite you to relax. If your stomach starts to grumble, you can have a sit in at the riverbend with a wide range of stalls and cafes offering beverages and food. Of course, the old town center has a lot to offer on a culture and culinarian level. Ride to the Karmeliterplatz for more inner city flair and be surrounded by cultural offerings and good restaurants.
vienna.bike-shops-content: Bicycle, fancy apparel and cycling culture can be found at Veletage. Besides to selected velocouture, bicycles and accessories, the salon offers great coffee and some good magazines. Definitely worth to spend some time here! If you are looking for a workshop that knows what all about the everyday life on the bike, citybiker provides you with great service and beautiful urban bikes. Ciclopia has a wide selection of bicycles and also offers workshops on how to fix and maintain your bike.
vienna.cafes-bars-content: If you like vegan and vegetarian food, we recommend a visit at Harvest-Bistrot at the Karmeliterplatz. If you prefer the more traditional Austrian kitchen, we highly recommend Plachutta. Order a traditional Tafelspitz or Wiener Schnitzel and enjoy it outside with the view on the famous Vienna Opera. You’ll have a great night to remember! For finishing touch of the day, it makes sense to walk towards the Danube. On the way you’ll find plenty of interesting bars or just sit outside under the stars at the river.

ampler.meta-descr: Test ride an E-Bike today! Electric assist bikes from Ampler available on listnride. Rent one in Berlin, Munich, Hamburg and Vienna.
ampler.title: Ampler. The smart electric bicycle for the urban commuter
ampler.description: Rent and test Ampler E-Bikes in Berlin, Munich, Hamburg, Vienna and Zurich
ampler.subdescription: Choose between Hawk, the dynamic single-speed or Bilberry, the comfortable city-bike
ampler.item1-description:
Made to order
Custom solutions
Attention to detail
Timeless Design
ampler.item2-description:
Upright riding position
Comfortable seat and grips
Stable kickstand
Lightweight
ampler.item3-description:
Smooth and quiet pedal assist
Comfortable user experience
Easy to charge
Long lasting
ampler.order-online:
Order one of their bikes online and get your rental reimbursed.
See the most frequently asked questions below.
ampler.faq-question-1: How often do I have to charge the battery?
ampler.faq-answer-1: The average range of the electric assist is 70 km, and if you run out of juice, you simply pedal on like you would on a regular bike. Charging the battery from drained to full takes only 3 hours. You can connect your charger to any regular power outlet.
ampler.faq-question-2: What happens when the battery dies?
ampler.faq-answer-2: After running out of battery power or turning off the assist, you can still ride with Ampler as you would do with a regular bicycle.
ampler.faq-answer-3: Yes. The frame and the battery are designed in such a way that every professional bike shop could remove the battery, and if needed, replace it with a new one in under one hour.
ampler.faq-question-4: How do I take care of the bike?
ampler.faq-answer-4: Maintenance is carried out as on a regular bicycle and every professional bike shop will be able to maintain our bikes.
ampler.faq-answer-5: Bikes are safely packed in a box and require minimal assembling.
ampler.faq-question-6: How to assemble the bike when delivered to my door?
ampler.faq-answer-6: Assembling the bike is super simple. We include the instructions with the bike. You can do it yourself or, if you prefer, take it to a local bike shop.
ampler.faq-answer-7: Yes. All Ampler bikes are covered for 2 years. However, the normal wear of tires, brake pads, chainrings, chain and bearings is an inevitable part of cycling thus not covered.
ampler.faq-answer-8: Yes. You can return the bike in 14 days after receiving it. The bike must be in its original condition for full refund. Please note that have to pay the return postage yourself.
ampler.faq-answer-9: Yes. Our bikes are capable of a top speed of 35km/h but by default are limited according to EN15194 to the top speed of 25 km/h. This means that the motor will only help you up to 25km/h. You can change these settings from the smartphone app.

brompton.meta-title: Rent a Brompton bike with listnride
brompton.meta-description: Test ride a Brompton bike today! These urban folding bikes are available on listnride. Rent one in Berlin, Munich, Hamburg, Düsseldorf or Frankfurt.
brompton.title: #FAHRMALBROMPTON
brompton.description: Rent a Brompton and test its excellent riding and folding characteristics.
brompton.subdescription: Experience Germany's cities different - with a bike perfect for the city.
brompton.item1-title: Free of charge to bring along
brompton.item1-description: Free to take along in local public transport (May be stowed in bag / transfer)
brompton.item2-description:
Folding in 10-20 seconds
Folding Size (HxWxD): 59cm x 57cm x 27cm
Easy to carry around (9-13 kg)
brompton.item3-description:
Top riding characteristics
English style
Handmade in London
brompton.find-out-more-ext: Learn more about Brompton at www.brompton.com
brompton.faq-question-1: What types of handlebars are available?
brompton.faq-answer-1:
Three different types:
M-Type - Classic shape, upright riding position
H-Type - For taller riders and everyone who likes to ride upright
S-Type Straight shape, sporty riding position
brompton.faq-question-2: How do I know which model it is?
brompton.faq-answer-2:
Brompton bicycles are always marked (eg H6LD). The individual characters stand for:
Steering Type: classic (M) / upright (H) / sporty (S)
Gear shift: 1-speed / 2-speed / 3-speed / 6-speed
Luggage rack: fenders, without luggage rack (L) / luggage rack and fenders (R)
Light: with dynamo (D) / battery light Set (-)
brompton.faq-question-3: What are the riding characteristics of the Brompton?
brompton.faq-answer-3: The small wheels allow the Brompton to accelerate quickly and make it very agile - ideal for the frequent stop and start urban traffic. The small diameter also increases the stability and strength of the rims. And an excellent suspension system ensures comfort on uneven ground and on long journeys.
brompton.faq-question-4: How can I use the luggage system?
brompton.faq-answer-4: The unique Brompton luggage system makes your bike fit for everyday use: it offers the right solution for almost every application. The bags are available in many different designs, materials and sizes - suitable for every situation. And since they are not fastened to the handlebars, but directly to the frame, they do not interfere with either steerability or stability. (Video)
brompton.faq-answer-5: There are four gearing options (1-gear, 2-gear, 3-gear and 6-gear). From the beginner to the experienced climber - for everyone there is the appropriate circuit.
brompton.faq-question-6: How does the folding mechanism work?
brompton.faq-answer-6: The Brompton has 3 folding axles, one for the two wheels and one for the steering rod. They are secured by easy-to-operate rotary locks. After folding, the chain and gear shift is inside so that they can not come into contact with clothing and luggage. (Video)

muli.meta-title: Rent a Muli cargo bike with listnride
muli.meta-description: Test ride a Muli cargo bike today! These urban cargo bikes are available on listnride. Rent one in Berlin or Munich.
muli.title: Designed for daily urban life
muli.description: Test and rent muli in Berlin or Munich
muli.subdescription: The muli is a hybrid between a compact citybike and a big cargo-bike. This combination makes a bike that perfectly suits daily city life.
muli.find-out-more-description: Learn more about muli cycles and how to buy one or check out their FAQ.

vello.meta-title: Rent and test VELLO E-Bikes in Berlin & Munich
vello.meta-description: VELLO BIKE+ The First Self-Charging Electric Folding Bike. The VELLO BIKE is a high-performance folding bike developed for the perfect urban cycling experience.
vello.title: Rent and test VELLO E-Bikes in Berlin & Munich
vello.description: The VELLO BIKE+ sets a new standard: using four electronic sensors, the energy supply is optimized for use, and activated only when you need it. When climbing uphill the power is there to assist you, and when you’re cruising downhill energy is recovered and fed back into the battery. The combination of a lightweight (from 10.9kg) folding bike, with a unique power system which gives you unlimited support, makes this the ultimate means of urban transportation. battery power.
vello.item1-description: This unique power system harvests energy during braking and coasting downhill, similar to many hybrid systems, but also converts mechanical energy into electrical energy thanks to the Integrated Kinetic Energy System (K.E.R.S.).
vello.item2-description: With an ultra-portable design, the VELLO is the lightest E-Bike on the market (clocking in at less than 12kg/ 26lbs), and capable of folding down to suitcase size for easy transport and carrying.
vello.item3-description: VELLO bikes are available in 4 different models, with e-drive and without: "Urbano", "Rocky", "Speedster" und "VELLO BIKE+". All models offer the best of urban riding, and come with high-end city, trekking, or road bike components.
vello.question: Questions?
vello.faq-question: Learn more about VELLO bikes and how to buy one or check out their FAQ.

veletage.meta-descr: VELETAGE Salon für Radkultur - Custom made racing bikes, clothing, wheelsets, bike fittings
veletage.subdescription: At VELETAGE, the salon for cycling culture in the heart of Vienna, you can rent the most beautiful, unique bicycles available, whether for a short test ride, a long weekend, or even a week of cycling around the city. We’re here to help with suggestions for scenic routes, and also help outfit you with the right apparel.  And if you follow us on Facebook, we’ll happily provide you with news and details about our upcoming group rides.
veletage.item1-description: With our unique selection on offer, we’ll find exactly the right bike for you. On top of that, we can help with our professional bike fitting service. Some of the brands we carry include Festka, Cervélo, Schindelhauer, and OPEN.
veletage.item2-description: The right clothing is almost as important as the perfect bike. With our many years of experience, we know what you need and can help you find what’s best for you. We carry clothing from Cafe du Cycliste, ashmei, Huez* and Velocio.
veletage.item3-description: Once you’ve found the perfect bike, we can help dial it in with a professional bike fitting. And before you hit the road, enjoy a cup of our delicious coffee.
veletage.find-out-more: Learn more about Veletage on Facebook or Instagram and sign up for our newsletter Velozette.

bonvelo.subdescription: The singlespeed/fixed-gear "bonvelo BLIZZ" is available to rent and test ride in Berlin in four frame sizes. Book one on listnride today!

4 frame sizes available

High quality components
Pure riding pleasure
bonvelo.item3-description:

High customer satisfaction
Personalized service
Speedy delivery to Berlin
bonvelo.test-bike: Test a bonvelo bike in Berlin
bonvelo.testimonial-1: Nice, clean design, and arrived neatly pre-assembled. I’m loving the ride.
bonvelo.testimonial-2: Very friendly customer service, quick processing of the order and super fast response to my questions.
bonvelo.testimonial-3: Bonvelo is awesome. Everything is right here. Great customer service -- they responded quickly even when I asked a question on Sunday. The delivery time was really fast, and the bike arrived almost fully assembled, with just a couple easy things to finish. The bike looks great, and the price was even better. Will definitely recommend. Cheers from Munich!
bonvelo.faq-description: When you order your bonvelo, we will refund you the cost of your rental / test ride in Berlin!
bonvelo.faq-question-1: What is a Singlespeed / Fixie bike?
bonvelo.faq-answer-1: For fast urban riding in (mostly) flat cities, the simplest way is to have just one gear. Singlespeed / Fixie bikes also benefit from a cleaner, more minimalist appearance. In addition to that, you can choose the position of the rear wheel; set it up as a singlespeed (freewheel / coasting possible), or as a fixed gear.
bonvelo.faq-question-2: What exactly is the difference between a Singlespeed and a Fixie?
bonvelo.faq-answer-2: It all comes down to one thing: the rear wheel. Singlespeed bikes have just one gear, but use a freehub which lets the rider coast without pedaling. The rider typically stops or slows the bike using rim brakes. When the wheel is mounted with the fixed hub, the bike becomes a fixed gear. In this setup, when the bike is rolling, the pedals are spinning - there’s no coasting. Experienced riders feel more control with this setup, and can stop or slow down using the pedals. We recommend always riding with both brakes fully assembled.
bonvelo.faq-question-3: What makes bonvelo bikes so great?
bonvelo.faq-answer-3: Do you commute daily to work or school? Perfect, because our bikes are made for this. Cobbles and rough roads are no problem for the 32-spoke wheel, and the Thickslick tire offers great durability and traction against anything the road puts underneath it. The frame is developed in-house - it’s extremely stable, and looks great, too. Bring all this together and the result is a dynamic, agile and durable bike, perfect for the urban jungle!
bonvelo.faq-question-4: How is my bonvelo delivered? What do I have to assemble?
bonvelo.faq-answer-4: We ship approximately 80% of our bikes to customers throughout Germany and the rest of Europe. We’ve chosen UPS as our shipping partner, and we pack our bikes securely in bike boxes for safe delivery to your door. Your bike will arrive 85% assembled - you just need to insert the front wheel, handlebars, saddle and pedals. We provide all the necessary tools!
bonvelo.faq-question-5: Why are the bikes so cheap?
bonvelo.faq-answer-5: We’re not concerned with frills or gimmicks, and designing a bike around this principle was an early goal of ours. All processes run directly through our manufacturers and producers, so there are no middlemen adding to the final price. We take care of everything else ourselves - our bikes are only available on our website and our showroom in Hamburg. From our customer feedback so far, we think we’re on the right track. Read here: bonvelo.de
bonvelo.faq-question-6: What else is there at bonvelo?
bonvelo.faq-answer-6: You can find great accessories for your bike here: bonvelo.de/fahrrad-zubehoer
bonvelo.bottom-text: To ride in maximum style, we’ve also got bonvelo hoodies, shirts and backpacks. Check out our selection at bonvelo.de/wear

invite-landing.subheader: Welcome to listnride, the Bike Sharing Community
invite-landing.subsubheader: listnride is the bike sharing community that brings together cycling enthusiasts of all sorts. Members can rent out their own bikes via our website or app, or rent a bike that perfectly suits their style and needs.
invite-landing.subsubsubheader: You've been invited by {{ name }}. Sign up now and you'll get a 10€ voucher added to your account. It can be used for your next bike rental.

invite-landing.explanation-1-description: Find the right bike near you and request it.
invite-landing.explanation-2-description: Book the bike and meet the lister to pick it up.

how-to-shoot-bike-photo.title: A couple of photo tips for a stand out listing
how-to-shoot-bike-photo.subtitle: The first thing prospective riders look at when considering a rental bicycle on listnride are the photos in the listing overview. Bike listings with good photos will receive more interest and more rentals.
how-to-shoot-bike-photo.content-1: Use natural light, set up your shot outside during daylight or indoors near a window or a white wall. Early morning and late afternoon light will produce best results.
how-to-shoot-bike-photo.content-2: Keep your background as simple as possible. Try to create a contrast to your bicycle. For example you can place your bicycle in front of a concrete wall.
how-to-shoot-bike-photo.content-3: Show some perspective of your bicycle, so rather shoot from an angle than a frontal perspective. Resolution matters: Take photos that are at least 1800 x 1200 pixel. When in doubt, a bigger photo is better.
how-to-shoot-bike-photo.content-4: Highlight what’s amazing. It is not required that the whole bicycle is shown on all photos, rather shoot some details, like brand name, colouring, lights, lock etc. Let pictures get the message across. Take your photos in landscape format: Vertical photos won’t showcase your bicycle as well.

invest.meta-title: listnride is crowdfunding! Be part of it and invest in Building Europe’s leading bike sharing community.
invest.meta-description: Visit Seedrs to learn more about investing in listnride.
invest.description: listnride is crowdfunding! Be part of it and invest in building Europe’s leading bike sharing community.
invest.subdescription: Learn more about listnride in our investor presentation and why it is worth to invest.
invest.subsubdescription: Soon, a crowdfunding campaign will start on Seedrs, Europe's largest equity crowdfunding platform. As an early adopter, business partner or friend, we're giving you first access, before we launch to the public. Tell us your level of interest and preregister without obligation.
invest.faq-question-1: WHY DOES LISTNRIDE START A CROWDFUNDING CAMPAIGN?
invest.faq-answer-1: We are a young company with a well developed product, a growing community of tenants and bicycle owners. To drive further growth, we offer the community and the public the opportunity to invest in our company alongside our current investors. With these additional resources, we will make further improvements to our product as well as continue to grow geographically and so grow the community, resulting in greater choice for riders and greater demand for listers.
invest.faq-question-2: HOW CAN I INVEST IN LISTNRIDE?
invest.faq-answer-2: We are working with Seedrs, the leading Crowdfunding platform from the United Kingdom to run our Crowdfunding campaign. To invest, simply create an account at www.seedrs.com and follow the instructions.
invest.faq-answer-3: Investing in startups involves risks, including loss of capital, illiquidity, lack of dividends and dilution, and it should be done only as part of a diversified portfolio. If you would like to read more Seedrs has a more detailed explanation about these risks here.
invest.faq-question-4: WHAT IS THE MINIMUM INVESTMENT AMOUNT?
invest.faq-answer-4: Because we want to involve as many people as possible, we keep the minimum investment amount low, around €10 (exact amount depends on exchange rates). We are happy to receive any amount!
invest.faq-question-5: WHAT HAS LISTNRIDE ACCOMPLISHED SO FAR?
invest.faq-answer-5: Since our official start in September 2016, launching a fully functional web platform: listnride has grown to be the largest community bike-sharing platform in the German speaking market (DE, AT, CH), with over 1.100 bikes listed and 1.600 registered users. listnride has already over 100 bike shops integrated and 5 innovative bike brands up and running with test ride programs. We have built up a strong presence in Berlin, Munich, Vienna, Amsterdam and Mallorca and are expanding into other large cities like Hamburg, Zurich and Düsseldorf.
invest.faq-question-6: HOW CAN I MAKE MONEY WITH MY INVESTMENT?
invest.faq-answer-6: To make a profit on your investment, you will generally need to sell your shares for more than the amount you invested. In a best case scenario, the value of your shares will rise in line with the growth of business you invested in, and you will be able to see your shares when the business floats on a stock exchange or is bought by another company (i.e. an exit event). More info here
invest.faq-question-7: WHAT IS THE MONEY RAISED USED FOR?
invest.faq-answer-7: We will use your invested money for two primary purposes: To finance our growth and win new users, especially in our existing markets / cities. Our community, with higher user numbers, can offer riders a wider choice, and provide higher demand to listers, making the service more appealing overall. To improve our platform steadily through new features that make the rental experience as easy and efficient as possible. Integrating an insurance product and new mobile apps are the biggest milestones set.
invest.faq-answer-8: We look forward to your interest and further questions. Just contact us at contact@listnride.com and we will get back to you as soon as possible.
